subject: AI & Agents
title: Explainable Recommendations
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Explainable Recommendations.

hook.text: 'Recommended for you' tells the user nothing. 'Because you watched Inception' builds trust.

buildup.text: Explainable recommendations tell users WHY an item was suggested.

discovery.text: Methods: item-based ('similar to X'), user-based ('people like you'), and feature-based ('because you like sci-fi').

twist.text: Good explanations increase click-through by 20% even when the underlying model is unchanged.

climax.text: Explanations also help debug: if the reason is wrong, the model has a problem.

quiz.question: Why do explainable recommendations improve performance?
options: They build user trust, increasing engagement
They make the model more accurate
